events.description: Nicolai Astrup is the Norwegian Minister of International Development, appointed by Prime Minister Erna Solberg.
supporting_quotes: Interview with His Excellency Nicolai Astrup, Minister of International Development of Norway
The Norwegian Prime Minister, Erna Solberg picked the right man for this important position

events.role: Member of the Secretary-General’s High-level Panel on Digital Cooperation
events.description: Astrup is one of 20 members appointed by UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres to contribute to the broader public debate on digital cooperation.
supporting_quotes: where he participated in the United Nations Secretary-General’s High-level Panel on Digital Cooperation
he is one of 20 members appointed by Antonio Guterres, appointed in his personal capacity

events.description: Working on a report to the Norwegian parliament about digitalization in development aid policy.
supporting_quotes: Now we are working on the elaboration of a report to the Norwegian parliament about digitalization in our development aid policy.

events.description: Visited a project in Malawi that uses digital learning materials for schoolchildren.
supporting_quotes: Last year, I visited Malawi, and a project that has benefited from Norwegian financial assistance.

events.description: Financed an application called EFAU for Syrian children in refugee camps.
supporting_quotes: We have also financed an application called EFAU for Syria, which is designed for Syrian children who live in refugee camps and who do not have access to ordinary schooling as they should have had under normal conditions.

events.description: Financed the MPESA Platform, a mobile phone banking service in Kenya.
supporting_quotes: Another application we have financed is the MPESA Platform, which is a mobile phone banking service being used by more than 30 million Kenyans.

events.description: Involved in Norwegian development aid projects, including a new alliance using Big Data to predict famine and a project to clean the ocean.
supporting_quotes: One of the biggest challenges that we are facing is marine pollution and marine debris.
We have therefore launched a new development project to clean the ocean.
We will use 1.6 billion NOK (1 USD = 8.5 NOK) over a 4-year period.
